item.title: Installing Python
item.description: Linux Check Existing Version: Many Linux distributions come with Python pre-installed. To check the existing version, open the terminal and run: 1python --version or 1python3 --version Installing Python 3 on Ubuntu: If Python 3 is not installed, you can run the following commands: 1sudo apt update 2sudo apt install python3 Installing on Other Linux Distributions: For other distributions, you can refer to the package manager specific to your distribution, such as yum for CentOS or zypper for openSUSE.
